name: Strike the Match Multiple Choice Quiz | American Football | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 2000 team rostered the likes of Thurman Thomas, Damon Huard, Leslie Shepherd, Jay Fiedler, and O.J. McDuffie.  Which AFC team was this?
questions.explanation:
Miami Dolphins.

	The 2000 season saw the Dolphins in their first season after the retirement of Dan Marino.  Jay Fiedler took over the QB duties, and threw 14 TDs with 14 INTs.

questions.text: Which 1986 team's roster included quarterbacks Ken Anderson and Boomer Esiason, and a receiving core of Cris Collinsworth and Eddie Brown?
questions.explanation:
Cincinnati Bengals.

	Esiason led the Bengals to a 10-6 season, but not good enough to make any postseason games.  This season was Boomer's career high for passing yards, falling just 41 yards shy of 4000.  1986 was Esiason's first of three Pro Bowl selections.

questions.text: This 1984 team finished 9-7 in the season.  Some of their players were Doug Cosbie, Tony Dorsett, Gary Hogeboom, Danny White, and Ron Springs.  Which NFC team was this?
questions.explanation:
Dallas Cowboys.

	The Cowboys finished two games behind the Redskins in 1984.  The 49ers who went 15-1, went on to win the Super Bowl against the Dolphins.

questions.text: Which 1976 team was star-studded with Pete Banaszak, Ken Stabler, Fred Biletnikoff, and Dave Casper?
questions.explanation:
Oakland Raiders.

	With coach John Madden at the helm, the Raiders went 13-1 in the season, then went all the way and won the Super Bowl against the Vikings, 32-14.

questions.text: Brian Griese, Jameel Cook, Joey Galloway, Nate Lawrie, and Matt Bryant all wore the uniform of which team in 2005?
questions.explanation:
Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

	After a dismal 5-11 season in 2004, the Buccaneers turned it around under John Gruden in 2005 to go 11-5.  However, Tampa Bay lost the NFC Wildcard game to the Redskins, 17-10.

questions.text: Quarterback Sid Luckman and running back Bronko Nagurski highlighted this 1943 team.  Which team was it?
questions.explanation:
Chicago Bears.

	Both Luckman and Nagurski crossed paths with the Bears in 1943.  The Bears went 8-1-1 in the season, and won the NFL Championship game over Washington, 41-21.

questions.text: This 1983 team had Gary Kubiak at quarterback, and running backs Rob Lytle, Nathan Poole, Dave Preston, and Sammy Winder.  Which team was it?
questions.explanation:
Denver Broncos.

	1983 was the first Bronco season of the great John Elway.  Steve Deberg was the other quarterback who shared the duties.  The Broncos went 9-7 in the season under coach Dan Reeves.

questions.text: This 1988 team had a variety of receivers in the names of Wes Chandler, Terry Greer, John Taylor, Mike Wilson, John Frank, Ron Heller, and Brent Jones.  Who were they?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco 49ers.

	The big name of this team's receiving roster was missing.  It was Jerry Rice, who combined with Steve Young and Joe Montana to take the 49ers to a Super Bowl victory over the Bengals, 20-16.

questions.text: This 1976 team had four quarterbacks including Steve Spurrier, Terry Hanratty, and an array of running backs in the names of Louis Carter, Charlie Davis, Jimmy Dubose, Essex Johnson, Rod McNeill, and Manfred Moore.  Which team was this?
questions.explanation:
Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

	1976 introduced the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to the NFL.  The team showed its appreciation by going 0-14 under John McKay, then went 2-12 in 1977.  The Buc's first winning season was when they went 10-6 in 1979.  In the first 20 seasons of the franchise, the team had a winning record only twice.

questions.text: Charlie Batch, Verron Haynes, Dan Kreider, Quincy Morgan, Matt Kranchick, Hines Ward, and Jeff Reed all blessed the roster of which 2005 team?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh Steelers.

	The Steelers were led by Ben Roethlisberger and Hines Ward.  Pittsburgh went all the way to win the Super Bowl against the Seahawks, 21-10.
